meanings.definition: Occurring, found, or done often; prevalent.
meanings.sent1: It is common to see birds in the park.
meanings.sent2: It is common for people to wear hats in the sun.
meanings.sent3: It was a common sight to see the cat chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The common occurrence of rain in the city brought relief to the drought.
meanings.sent5: The common practice of recycling helps protect the environment.

meanings.definition: Shared by, coming from, or done by more than one.
meanings.sent1: The common goal of the team was to win the championship.
meanings.sent2: The common responsibility of the group was to clean up after the party.
meanings.sent3: It was a common decision to split the bill evenly among friends.
meanings.sent4: Their common bond over music brought them closer together.
meanings.sent5: The common effort of the community led to a successful fundraiser.
